refnamediv.refpurpose: A GtkObject representing an adjustable bounded value

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: lower gdouble : Read / Write page-increment gdouble : Read / Write page-size gdouble : Read / Write step-increment gdouble : Read / Write upper gdouble : Read / Write value gdouble : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: changed : Run First / No Recursion value-changed : Run First / No Recursion

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkAdjustment object represents a value which has an associated lower and upper bound, together with step and page increments, and a page size. It is used within several GTK+ widgets, including GtkSpinButton, GtkViewport, and GtkRange (which is a base class for GtkHScrollbar, GtkVScrollbar, GtkHScale, and GtkVScale).
The GtkAdjustment object does not update the value itself. Instead it is left up to the owner of the GtkAdjustment to control the value.

The owner of the GtkAdjustment typically calls the gtk_adjustment_value_changed() and gtk_adjustment_changed() functions after changing the value and its bounds. This results in the emission of the "value_changed" or "changed" signal respectively.

refsect2.title: GtkAdjustment
gtk_adjustment_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkObject* gtk_adjustment_new (gdouble value, gdouble lower, gdouble upper, gdouble step_increment, gdouble page_increment, gdouble page_size);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkAdjustment.

refsect2.title: gtk_adjustment_get_value ()
refsect2.para: Gets the current value of the adjustment. See gtk_adjustment_set_value().

listitem.simpara: The current value of the adjustment.

refsect2.title: gtk_adjustment_set_value ()
refsect2.para: Sets the GtkAdjustment value. The value is clamped to lie between adjustment->lower and adjustment->upper.
Note that for adjustments which are used in a GtkScrollbar, the effective range of allowed values goes from adjustment->lower to adjustment->upper - adjustment->page_size.

refsect2.title: gtk_adjustment_clamp_page ()
refsect2.para: Updates the GtkAdjustment value to ensure that the range between lower and upper is in the current page (i.e. between value and value + page_size). If the range is larger than the page size, then only the start of it will be in the current page. A "changed" signal will be emitted if the value is changed.

refsect2.title: gtk_adjustment_changed ()
refsect2.para: Emits a "changed" signal from the GtkAdjustment. This is typically called by the owner of the GtkAdjustment after it has changed any of the GtkAdjustment fields other than the value.

refsect2.title: gtk_adjustment_value_changed ()
refsect2.para: Emits a "value_changed" signal from the GtkAdjustment. This is typically called by the owner of the GtkAdjustment after it has changed the GtkAdjustment value field.

refsect2.title: The :lower property
refsect2.para: The minimum value of the adjustment.
Default value: 0
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The :page-increment property
refsect2.para: The page increment of the adjustment.
Default value: 0
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The :page-size property
refsect2.para: The page size of the adjustment. Note that the page-size is irrelevant and should be set to zero if the adjustment is used for a simple scalar value, e.g. in a GtkSpinButton.
Default value: 0
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The :step-increment property
refsect2.para: The step increment of the adjustment.
Default value: 0
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The :upper property
refsect2.para: The maximum value of the adjustment. Note that values will be restricted by upper - page-size if the page-size property is nonzero.
Default value: 0
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The :value property
refsect2.para: The value of the adjustment.
Default value: 0
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The ::changed signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkAdjustment *adjustment, gpointer user_data) : Run First / No Recursion
refsect2.para: Emitted when one or more of the GtkAdjustment fields have been changed, other than the value field.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.

refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkAdjustment *adjustment, gpointer user_data) : Run First / No Recursion
